verses.text: As \w snow|strong="H7950"\w* in \w summer|strong="H7019"\w*, and as \w rain|strong="H4306"\w* in \w harvest|strong="H7105"\w*, so \w honour|strong="H3519"\w* is not \w seemly|strong="H5000"\w* for a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w*.

As the \w bird|strong="H6833"\w* by \w wandering|strong="H5110"\w*, as the \w swallow|strong="H1866"\w* by \w flying|strong="H5774"\w*, so the \w curse|strong="H7045"\w* \w causeless|strong="H2600"\w* shall not \w come|strong="H0935"\w*.

A \w whip|strong="H7752"\w* for the \w horse|strong="H5483"\w*, a \w bridle|strong="H4964"\w* for the \w ass|strong="H2543"\w*, and a \w rod|strong="H7626"\w* for the \w fool’s|strong="H3684"\w* \w back|strong="H1460"\w*.
\w Answer|strong="H6030"\w* not a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* according to his \w folly|strong="H0200"\w*, lest thou also be \w like|strong="H7737"\w* unto him.

\w Answer|strong="H6030"\w* a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* according to his \w folly|strong="H0200"\w*, lest he be \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* in his own \w conceit|strong="H5869"\w*.\f + \fr 26.5 \ft conceit: Heb. eyes\f*

He that \w sendeth|strong="H7971"\w* a \w message|strong="H1697"\w* by the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* cutteth \w off|strong="H7096"\w* the \w feet|strong="H7272"\w*, \add and\add* \w drinketh|strong="H8354"\w* \w damage|strong="H2555"\w*.\f + \fr 26.6 \ft damage: or, violence\f*

The \w legs|strong="H7785"\w* of the \w lame|strong="H6455"\w* are not \w equal|strong="H1809"\w*: so \add is\add* a \w parable|strong="H4912"\w* in the \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* of \w fools|strong="H3684"\w*.\f + \fr 26.7 \ft are…: Heb. are lifted up\f*

As he that \w bindeth|strong="H6872"\w* a \w stone|strong="H0068"\w* in a \w sling|strong="H4773"\w*, so \add is\add* he that \w giveth|strong="H5414"\w* \w honour|strong="H3519"\w* to a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w*.\f + \fr 26.8 \ft bindeth…: or, putteth a precious stone in an heap of stones\f*

\add As\add* a \w thorn|strong="H2336"\w* goeth \w up|strong="H5927"\w* into the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of a \w drunkard|strong="H7910"\w*, so \add is\add* a \w parable|strong="H4912"\w* in the \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* of \w fools|strong="H3684"\w*.

The \w great|strong="H7227"\w* \add God\add* that \w formed|strong="H2342"\w* all \add things\add* both \w rewardeth|strong="H7936"\w* the \w fool|strong="H3684"\w*, and \w rewardeth|strong="H7936"\w* \w transgressors|strong="H5674"\w*.\f + \fr 26.10 \ft The great…: or, A great man grieveth all, and he hireth the fool, he hireth also transgressors\f*

As a \w dog|strong="H3611"\w* \w returneth|strong="H7725"\w* to his \w vomit|strong="H6892"\w*, \add so\add* a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* \w returneth|strong="H8138"\w* to his \w folly|strong="H0200"\w*.\f + \fr 26.11 \ft returneth to his folly: Heb. iterateth his folly\f*

\w Seest|strong="H7200"\w* thou a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* in his own \w conceit|strong="H5869"\w*? \add there is\add* more \w hope|strong="H8615"\w* of a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* than of him.

The \w slothful|strong="H6102"\w* \add man\add* \w saith|strong="H0559"\w*, \add There is\add* a \w lion|strong="H7826"\w* in the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*; a \w lion|strong="H0738"\w* \add is\add* in the \w streets|strong="H7339"\w*.
\add As\add* the \w door|strong="H1817"\w* \w turneth|strong="H5437"\w* upon his \w hinges|strong="H6735"\w*, so \add doth\add* the \w slothful|strong="H6102"\w* upon his \w bed|strong="H4296"\w*.

The \w slothful|strong="H6102"\w* \w hideth|strong="H2934"\w* his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* in \add his\add* \w bosom|strong="H6747"\w*; it \w grieveth|strong="H3811"\w* him to bring it \w again|strong="H7725"\w* to his \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*.\f + \fr 26.15 \ft it grieveth…: or, he is weary\f*

The \w sluggard|strong="H6102"\w* \add is\add* \w wiser|strong="H2450"\w* in his own \w conceit|strong="H5869"\w* than seven \w men|strong="H7651"\w* that can \w render|strong="H7725"\w* a \w reason|strong="H2940"\w*.

He that passeth \w by|strong="H5674"\w*, \add and\add* \w meddleth|strong="H5674"\w* with \w strife|strong="H7379"\w* \add belonging\add* not to him, \add is like\add* one that \w taketh|strong="H2388"\w* a \w dog|strong="H3611"\w* by the \w ears|strong="H0241"\w*.\f + \fr 26.17 \ft meddleth: or, is enraged\f*

As a \w mad|strong="H3856"\w* \add man\add* who \w casteth|strong="H3384"\w* \w firebrands|strong="H2131"\w*, \w arrows|strong="H2671"\w*, and \w death|strong="H4194"\w*,\f + \fr 26.18 \ft firebrands: Heb. flames, or, sparks\f*
So \add is\add* the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \add that\add* \w deceiveth|strong="H7411"\w* his \w neighbour|strong="H7453"\w*, and \w saith|strong="H0559"\w*, Am not I in \w sport|strong="H7832"\w*?

Where \w no|strong="H0657"\w* \w wood|strong="H6086"\w* is, \add there\add* the \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* goeth \w out|strong="H3518"\w*: so where \add there is\add* no \w talebearer|strong="H5372"\w*, the \w strife|strong="H4066"\w* \w ceaseth|strong="H8367"\w*.\f + \fr 26.20 \ft Where no…: Heb. Without wood\f*\f + \fr 26.20 \ft talebearer: or, whisperer\f*\f + \fr 26.20 \ft ceaseth: Heb. is silent\f*

\add As\add* \w coals|strong="H6352"\w* \add are\add* to burning \w coals|strong="H1513"\w*, and \w wood|strong="H6086"\w* to \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*; so \add is\add* a \w contentious|strong="H4079"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w* to \w kindle|strong="H2787"\w* \w strife|strong="H7379"\w*.

The \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of a \w talebearer|strong="H5372"\w* \add are\add* as \w wounds|strong="H3859"\w*, and they go \w down|strong="H3381"\w* into the innermost \w parts|strong="H2315"\w* of the \w belly|strong="H0990"\w*.\f + \fr 26.22 \ft innermost…: Heb. chambers\f*

\w Burning|strong="H1814"\w* \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* and a \w wicked|strong="H7451"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \add are like\add* a \w potsherd|strong="H2789"\w* \w covered|strong="H6823"\w* with \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* \w dross|strong="H5509"\w*.

He that \w hateth|strong="H8130"\w* \w dissembleth|strong="H5234"\w* with his \w lips|strong="H8193"\w*, and layeth \w up|strong="H7896"\w* \w deceit|strong="H4820"\w* \w within|strong="H7130"\w* him;\f + \fr 26.24 \ft dissembleth: or, is known\f*

When he \w speaketh|strong="H6963"\w* \w fair|strong="H2603"\w*, \w believe|strong="H0539"\w* him not: for \add there are\add* \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w abominations|strong="H8441"\w* in his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*.\f + \fr 26.25 \ft speaketh…: Heb. maketh his voice gracious\f*

\add Whose\add* \w hatred|strong="H8135"\w* is \w covered|strong="H3680"\w* by \w deceit|strong="H4860"\w*, his \w wickedness|strong="H7451"\w* shall be \w shewed|strong="H1540"\w* before the \add whole\add* \w congregation|strong="H6951"\w*.\f + \fr 26.26 \ft by…: or, in secret\f*

Whoso \w diggeth|strong="H3738"\w* a \w pit|strong="H7845"\w* shall \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* therein: and he that \w rolleth|strong="H1556"\w* a \w stone|strong="H0068"\w*, it will \w return|strong="H7725"\w* upon him.

A \w lying|strong="H8267"\w* \w tongue|strong="H3956"\w* \w hateth|strong="H8130"\w* \add those that are\add* \w afflicted|strong="H1790"\w* by it; and a \w flattering|strong="H2509"\w* \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* \w worketh|strong="H6213"\w* \w ruin|strong="H4072"\w*.
